name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text: The reforms needed for our immigration detention system go far beyond just one facility, and I will continue to advocate at the federal level for solutions that center the civil and human rights of immigrants in Washington and across the country.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text: I recently visited the NW Detention Center in Tacoma, an immigration detention center owned and operated by the GEO Group. I was clear that me and other members of Congress will continue to closely monitor the facility, which has historically failed to provide humane conditions.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text: Our immigration detention system is in need of drastic reform. We must promote universal access to legal counsel for immigrants, enhance oversight and accountability for facilities, reduce our reliance on immigration detention, and finally prohibit for-profit detention centers.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text: We have a responsibility to people entering this country that they will be treated with dignity and respect when they cross the border – but this is sadly counter to the for-profit detention center companies who prioritize profits over anything else.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text: 988 will help enhance public safety, deliver better outcomes for community members, and reduce strain on the relationship between police officers and the people they are sworn to serve. This lifeline is a great resource for our community and our country.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text: Members of our community will be able to call 988 if they are witnessing or experiencing a mental health crisis. 988 will work in conjunction with 911 to ensure that trained professionals - such as social workers, paramedics, and peer support counselors - respond to the call.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text:
I wrote an op-ed for the @seattletimes about the need to reform police response and the success that 911 diversion programs could bring to communities across the country:
https://t.co/v5jjMChR1x

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text: That's why I authored the 911 Diversion to Unarmed Personnel Act, which would provide funding for unarmed crisis response teams that divert nonviolent 911 calls to specialized service providers who are better equipped to handle these calls.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text: 1 in every 10 calls for police response involves a person suffering from a mental illness, and in most places around the U.S. operators have no choice but to deploy police officers to every scene, regardless of whether they are equipped or trained to handle these situations.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text: I will first join @SecBecerra, @PattyMurray, @RepJayapal, and @RepKimSchrieron a tour of Crisis Connections, which will be a key partner in the transition to the 988 National Suicide Prevention Lifeline.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text:
But these aren’t just numbers. They show just how much the United States, our allies, and partners are willing to help the Ukrainian people in their time of need.

We’ve stood with the Ukrainian people, we’re standing with them now, and we’re going to keep standing with them.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text:
$13.6 billion.

That's how much humanitarian, military, and economic support Congress included for Ukraine in the recent government funding bill.

When we passed this legislation, we sent a message to the Ukrainian people (and Putin): more help is on the way for Ukraine.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text:
$500 million.

That's how much direct budgetary aid to the Ukrainian government President Biden announced today.

President Zelenskyy and the Ukrainians have stood up to Putin's aggression, and these funds show that the United States stands with them now and in the future.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text:
$1 billion.

That's how much @POTUS announced last week in new humanitarian assistance funding for the Ukrainian people.

Led by @PowerUSAID, agencies like @USAID are delivering crucial aid to innocent civilians whose lives and livelihoods have been upended by this conflict.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text:
35 nations.

That's how many have sent some form of security assistance to President Zelenskyy and the Ukrainians.

President Biden's team of diplomats is working tirelessly with our allies and partners to help Ukraine defend itself against Russia's brutal war.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text:
$350 million.

That’s how much security assistance the Biden-Harris administration has delivered to the Ukrainians in just the past three weeks, including U.S.-produced air defense systems and anti-tank systems like Stingers and Javelins.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text:
Over one month since Russia’s full-scale invasion began, I want to make something clear:

The security assistance and humanitarian aid that the United States and our partners are providing to the Ukrainian people is making an enormous difference.

Here's how — in five numbers:

name: Rep. Adam Smith

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text: The bill invalidates pre-dispute arbitration agreements if they require arbitration of an employment, consumer, antitrust, or civil rights dispute - which would prevent big corporations from using unfair arbitration to stop workers and consumers from seeking justice.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text:
Forced arbitration clauses prevent consumers and workers from going to court if their rights have been violated. 

Last week the House passed the Forced Arbitration Injustice Repeal (FAIR) Act to end this unjust practice.

The JCPOA didn't cover every instance of Iran's rogue behavior – but it was better than no deal at all, and we should explore every possible opportunity alongside our allies and partners to return to it.

We have to give diplomacy a chance, especially on subjects this important.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text:
The JCPOA included monitoring and verification measures for the global community to closely track Iran's nuclear program, and it imposed limits on Iran's ability to acquire a nuclear weapon.

Withdrawing from the deal cleared these crucial roadblocks from Iran's nuclear path.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text:
Trump's withdrawal from the JCPOA and his administration’s strategy of “maximum pressure” failed.

With the United States out of the JCPOA, Iran reduced its breakout time for getting a nuclear weapon and doubled down on its malign activities throughout the region.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text:
When the last administration withdrew from the JCPOA, I warned that withdrawal would not address Iran's malign actions in the Middle East or prevent Tehran from getting a nuclear weapon.

tweet_text:
Today @POTUS makes history by nominating the first Black woman to the Court.
 
Congratulations, Judge Jackson on this incredible achievement. I look forward to your confirmation & watching as you protect the rights & freedoms of the American people & the will of our Constitution.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text: With each of these nominations, Judge Jackson was confirmed with strong bipartisan support because of her broad set of experiences, her diverse legal perspective, and her unwavering commitment to equal justice under the law.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text: In 2009, President Obama nominated her to serve as Vice Chair of the U.S. Sentencing Commission and then in 2012 as a district judge for the U.S. District Court for D.C. In 2021, she was nominated by President Biden to serve on the U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text: Judge Jackson spent years as a public defender, and will become the first former federal public defender to serve on the Supreme Court.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text: Judge Jackson will be an exceptional addition to the Court, bringing her impressive credentials – having graduated cum laude from Harvard Law School – and her immense qualifications from years of experience in public service.

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text: Today, @POTUS nominated one our country's brightest legal minds, Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson, to serve on the United States Supreme Court.

#BuildBackBetter will reduce housing costs and expand housing options by providing funding for rental assistance and the construction and rehabilitation of over 1 million affordable housing units nationwide. (1/2)

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text: #BuildBackBetter includes $3B for environmental and climate justice grants to fund community-led projects and $29 billion to finance local projects that reduce greenhouse gas emissions, 40 percent of which must be made in low-income and disadvantaged communities. (2/2)

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text:

#BuildBackBetter provides funding for training programs that will prepare America’s workers for good jobs across our fastest growing sectors.

In Washington State alone, 34 public community colleges will benefit from grants to develop and strengthen training programs. (2/2)

name: Rep. Adam Smith

name: Rep. Adam Smith

#BuildBackBetter will put us on a pathway towards a cleaner, greener, safer environment and economy.  

Let's sign this bill into law and make history. (4/4)

-$20B for clean energy procurement 
-$29B for a greenhouse gas reduction fund to invest in local projects
-$3B for environmental and climate justice grants (3/4)

-$320B for clean energy tax credits and incentives 
-$105B for resilience investments 
-$110B for clean energy technology, manufacturing, and supply chains 
(2/4)

name: Rep. Adam Smith

name: Rep. Adam Smith

name: Rep. Adam Smith
tweet_text:
Our initial mission in Afghanistan – to hold those who planned 9/11 accountable and prevent a similar attack on the homeland – was successful.

But over time, that mission grew too broad as we tried to help create an Afghan government that could provide for its own security.
